list.author: Thomas Edison
list.content: To invent, you need a good imagination and a pile of junk.

list.author: Alan Watts
list.content: Technology is destructive only in the hands of people who do not realize that they are one and the same process as the universe.
Computers are like bikinis. They save people a lot of guesswork.
list.author: Sam Ewing

list.content: Technology is a word that describes something that doesn't work yet.
list.author: Douglas Adams

list.content: Science and technology revolutionize our lives, but memory, tradition and myth frame our response.
list.author: Arthur M. Schlesinger Jr.

list.content: The human spirit must prevail over technology.
list.author: Albert Einstein

list.content: Technology has to be invented or adopted.
list.author: Jared Diamond

list.content: The problem with Google is you have 360 degrees of omnidirectional information on a linear basis, but the algorithms for irony and ambiguity are not there. And those are the algorithms of wisdom.
list.author: William Hurt

list.content: The greatest achievement of humanity is not its works of art, science, or technology, but the recognition of its own dysfunction.
list.author: Eckhart Tolle

list.content: Computers are useless. They can only give you answers.
list.author: Pablo Picasso

list.content: First we thought the PC was a calculator. Then we found out how to turn numbers into letters with ASCII — and we thought it was a typewriter. Then we discovered graphics, and we thought it was a television. With the World Wide Web, we've realized it's a brochure.
list.author: Douglas Adams

list.content: The great myth of our times is that technology is communication.
list.author: Libby Larsen

list.content: We are stuck with technology when what we really want is just stuff that works.
list.author: Douglas Adams

list.content: Technology is the campfire around which we tell our stories.
list.author: Laurie Anderson

list.content: TV and the Internet are good because they keep stupid people from spending too much time out in public.
list.author: Douglas Coupland

list.content: This is why I loved technology: if you used it right, it could give you power and privacy.
list.author: Cory Doctorow

list.content: Technology is nothing. What's important is that you have a faith in people, that they're basically good and smart, and if you give them tools, they'll do wonderful things with them.
list.author: Steve Jobs

list.content: The art challenges the technology, and the technology inspires the art.
list.author: John Lasseter

list.content: Just because something doesn't do what you planned it to do doesn't mean it's useless.
list.author: Thomas Edison

list.content: It is through science that we prove, but through intuition that we discover.
list.author: Henri Poincaré

list.content: All of our technology is completely unnecessary to a happy life.
list.author: Tom Hodgkinson

list.content: Humanity is acquiring all the right technology for all the wrong reasons.
list.author: Buckminster Fuller

list.content: Imagination is more important than knowledge. For while knowledge defines all we currently know and understand, imagination points to all we might yet discover and create.
list.author: Albert Einstein

list.content: Technology… is a queer thing. It brings you great gifts with one hand, and it stabs you in the back with the other.
list.author: Carrie Snow

list.content: Technology frightens me to death. It's designed by engineers to impress other engineers. And they always come with instruction booklets that are written by engineers for other engineers — which is why almost no technology ever works.
list.author: John Cleese

list.content: I think that novels that leave out technology misrepresent life as badly as Victorians misrepresented life by leaving out sex.
list.author: Kurt Vonnegut

list.content: Technology presumes there's just one right way to do things and there never is.
list.author: Robert M. Pirsig

list.content: All this modern technology just makes people try to do everything at once.
list.author: Bill Watterson

list.content: One machine can do the work of fifty ordinary men. No machine can do the work of one extraordinary man.
list.author: Elbert Hubbard

list.content: The ultimate promise of technology is to make us master of a world that we command by the push of a button.
list.author: Volker Grassmuck

list.content: Technology is teaching us to be human again.
list.author: Simon Mainwaring

list.content: The real danger is not that computers will begin to think like men, but that men will begin to think like computers.
list.author: Sydney J. Harris

list.content: Any sufficiently advanced technology is equivalent to magic.
list.author: Arthur C. Clarke

list.content: Ethics change with technology.
list.author: Larry Niven

list.content: Communications tools don't get socially interesting until they get technologically boring.
list.author: Clay Shirky

list.content: Technology is anything that wasn't around when you were born.
list.author: Man Ray

list.content: This is the whole point of technology. It creates an appetite for immortality on the one hand. It threatens universal extinction on the other. Technology is lust removed from nature.
list.author: Don DeLillo

list.content: Once a new technology rolls over you, if you're not part of the steamroller, you're part of the road.
list.author: Stewart Brand

list.content: It's supposed to be automatic, but actually you have to push this button.
list.author: John Brunner

list.content: The most technologically efficient machine that man has ever invented is the book.
list.author: Northrop Frye

list.content: It has become appallingly obvious that our technology has exceeded our humanity.
list.author: Albert Einstein

list.content: As a technology, the book is like a hammer. That is to say, it is perfect: a tool ideally suited to its task. Hammers can be tweaked and varied but will never go obsolete. Even when builders pound nails by the thousand with pneumatic nail guns, every household needs a hammer.
list.author: James Gleick

list.content: Technology made large populations possible; large populations now make technology indispensable.
list.author: Joseph Wood Krutch

list.content: Great ideas often receive violent opposition from mediocre minds.
list.author: Albert Einstein

list.content: Programs must be written for people to read, and only incidentally for machines to execute.
list.author: Hal Abelson

list.content: Technology… the knack of so arranging the world that we don't have to experience it.
list.author: Max Frisch

list.content: The real problem is not whether machines think but whether men do.
list.author: B. F. Skinner

list.content: Technological progress has merely provided us with more efficient means for going backwards.
list.author: Aldous Huxley

list.content: If you can't explain it simply, you don't understand it well enough.
list.author: Albert Einstein

list.content: So much technology, so little talent.
list.author: Vernor Vinge
